node.title: Elle magazine says it will drop fur from magazines worldwide
node.alt: Front cover of magazine with female model.
node.description: Elle magazine says it will stop using fur in all its editorial and advertising content worldwide, becoming the first major publication to do so.
node.content:
["Elle magazine says it will stop using fur in all its editorial and advertising content worldwide, becoming the first major publication to do so.", "The monthly lifestyle magazine, which originated in France and is owned by French media group Lagardere, comes out in 45 different editions around the world.", "It has about 33 million readers and 100 million monthly online visitors.", "But Elle's international director Valeria Bessolo Llopiz said fur was no longer acceptable in the industry.", "\"The presence of animal fur in our pages and on our digital media is no longer in line with our values, nor our readers,\" she said\u00a0during the annual Business of Fashion Voices event in Britain.", "Instead, she said, the magazine wanted to \"increase awareness for animal welfare\" and \"foster a more humane fashion industry\".", "The magazine has already dropped fur from 13 of its editions. Twenty more will remove fur from their pages on January 1.\u00a0The rest will start a year later.", "The move reflects the changing nature of consumer demand, Ms\u00a0Bessolo Llopiz said.", "\"Fur has become old fashioned,\" she said, noting many brands had gone \"fur-free\" years ago.", "Welcoming Elle's decision, PJ Smith, director of fashion policy for the Humane Society of the United States, said he looked forward to other fashion magazines following suit.", "\"This announcement will ignite positive change throughout the entire fashion industry and has the potential to save countless animals from a life of suffering and a cruel death,\" he told the conference.", "
Consumer pressure leading to fur being phased out
", "The decision comes as the fashion industry faces\u00a0pressure from animal rights activists and the public to stop using\u00a0real fur.", "Smaller fashion weeks held in cities such as Amsterdam, Oslo, Melbourne and Helsinki have all banned fur, but larger ones in Paris, Milan and New York leave it up to designers.", "Many big names that have already chosen to no longer use fur include Gucci, Versace,\u00a0Prada, Burberry, Vivienne Westwood, Alexander McQueen, Donna Karan, DKNY, Michael Kors, Jean-Paul Gaultier and Balenciaga.", "A 2020 YouGov survey found 93 per cent of British people refused to wear natural fur while another by Research Co suggested that in the US, 71 per cent opposed killing animals for their fur.", "In Europe, an FOP poll indicated 90 per cent of French people opposed the fur trade, while 86 per cent of Italians expressed opposition in a 2019 survey by Eurispes.", "In a German poll by Kantar in 2020, 84 per cent said cruelty towards animals and killing them for their fur was unacceptable.", "Israel in June became the world's first country to ban selling fur to the fashion industry.", "
Fur industry says bans could harm the environment
", "The fur industry argues its natural product is being replaced with synthetic fur that is made with plastics that damage the environment.", "The French fur industry federation said in a statement on Thursday evening it would \"consider suing\" Elle's\u00a0platform for \"refusing to sell\".", "The fur industry believes the decisions of designers and consumers are being forced by \"pressure from radical movements\".", "While fake fur coats are often made from polyester, which takes hundreds of years to biodegrade, some designers such as Britain's Stella McCartney opt for plant-based materials.", "Others use natural fibres such as wool and feathers to mimic the appearance of fur.", "AFP"]
